intro: Psychotria ronaldii, commonly known as Ronald's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the rainforests of Central and South America, particularly in regions of Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It contains various alkaloids, some of which have been studied for their potential pharmacological properties. Due to its habitat specificity and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
